member.name: T:LinqStatistics.Range
member.summary: An ordered pair of values, representing a segment.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the struct.
member.param: When true Contains will include the max value.

member.summary: Indicates whether this instance and a specified object are equal.

member.summary: Returns the hash code for this instance.

member.summary: Returns the fully qualified type name of this instance.

member.summary: Indicates whether the current object is equal to another object of the same type.

member.returns: true if the current object is equal to the parameter; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:LinqStatistics.Range.MaxInclusive
member.summary: Determines whether max should be included in the range or excluded

member.name: P:LinqStatistics.Range.Min
member.summary: Gets the minimal value of segment.

member.name: P:LinqStatistics.Range.Max
member.summary: Gets the maximal value of segment.

member.name: T:LinqStatistics.BinningMode
member.summary: Controls how the range of the bins are determined

member.name: F:LinqStatistics.BinningMode.Unbounded
member.summary: The minimum will be equal to the sequence min and the maximum equal to infinity

member.name: F:LinqStatistics.BinningMode.MaxValueInclusive
member.summary: The minimum will be the sequnce min and the maximxum equal to sequence max The last bin will max inclusive instead of exclusive

member.name: F:LinqStatistics.BinningMode.ExpandRange
member.summary: The total range will be expanded such that the min is less then the sequence min and max is greater then the sequence max

member.name: M:LinqStatistics.TestHist.Histogram(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Int32},System.Int32,LinqStatistics.BinningMode)
member.summary: Computes the Histogram of a sequence of int values.
member.param: A sequence of int values to calculate the Histogram of.
The number of bins into which to segregate the data.
The method used to determine the range of each bin
member.returns: The Histogram of the sequence of int values.
